item.title: Revisiting the Many Instruments Problem using Random Matrix Theory
item.description: arXiv:2408.08580v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: We use recent results from the theory of random matrices to improve instrumental variables estimation with many instruments. In settings where the first-stage parameters are dense, we show that Ridge lowers the implicit price of a bias adjustment. This comes along with improved (finite-sample) properties in the second stage regression. Our theoretical results nest existing results on bias approximation and bias adjustment. Moreover, it extends them to settings with more instruments than observations.
item.dc:creator: Helmut Farbmacher, Rebecca Groh, Michael M\"uhlegger, Gabriel Vollert
